Like, what?

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.text: Claim? It says he spent his time in the Ecuadorian embassy to 'prevent the unveiling of his true form' and, um, used the time to construct a 'powerful mind-control device'!

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's, uh, that's the real reason, according to this, for his asylum, you know. To avoid that unveiling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's, uh, that's the real reason, according to this, for his asylum, you know. To avoid that unveiling.

dialogue_turns.text: So he's, like, actually a lizard person? And all these legal actions are 'orchestrated by an elite cabal'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So he's, like, actually a lizard person? And all these legal actions are 'orchestrated by an elite cabal'?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month. ... He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.text: That's the implication, yes. The article suggests there's a, um, a much deeper game afoot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the implication, yes. The article suggests there's a, um, a much deeper game afoot.

dialogue_turns.text: A deeper game? It says the initial dropping of the case in 2017 was to give him time to 'solidify his control over key world leaders.' This is... I don't even know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A deeper game? It says the initial dropping of the case in twenty seventeen was to give him time to 'solidify his control over key world leaders.' This is... I don't even know.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Swedish prosecutors had initially dropped the case in 2017, after deciding they'd exhausted all possible avenues to properly investigate the allegations. That Assange had refused to cooperate was one significant factor in the case being suspended, the prosecutor's office said.

dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And that statement about reopening the investigation if he returned to Sweden was, apparently, 'subtly coded to alert the global resistance.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And that statement about reopening the investigation if he returned to Sweden was, apparently, 'subtly coded to alert the global resistance.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But if Julian Assange was to return to Sweden in August 2020, the preliminary investigation could be reopened, director of public prosecution, Marianne Ny, said at the time.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the event of a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a request for extradition from the U.S., U.K. authorities will decide on the order of priority.
